alert.note: Alert for Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 07 at 10:26PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...The following area, Taiya River. * WHEN...Through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...The Taiya River may rise out of their banks and start to inundate the first few miles of the Chilkoot trail to ankle depth. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Unusually warm daytime temperatures into the 70s and 80s through the weekend may accelerate snow and glacier ice melt in the Taiya River basin. River levels are expected to rise to the point that water may start to cause issues for the Chilkoot Trail by Saturday morning causing minor flooding. Highest water levels are expected Saturday morning and Sunday morning. There is uncertainty on how high the river will get with the possibilities ranging from bankfull conditions to minor flooding in some areas. - If you live near or along the Taiya River stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
